issue.title: www.yahoo.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [https://www.yahoo.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.yahoo.com%2F) ### Comment > Prior to the most recent update, i had setup custom the previous version blocked the ads but left empty spaces as per the screenshot i shared. I manually blocked all the individual "empty" ad spaces using manual/custom rules and the yahoo page was ad free and no random spaces. AFTER the update to the most recent version, the ads themselves were blocked but the random "ad" spaces remained. I manually blocked all those random spaces again with custom block rules. But, the yahoo auto-refreshes and every time, the "empty ad" spaces return despite of how many times I block them. Its not an issue, more like an FYI for you guys. My custom block rules are rendered useless once the page refreshes every time. ``` Username: @Hear AdGuard ``` ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/ehjvqbpemvsc8o0oscgo4ow04sk4444jz7cijwa7y8.png?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard for Windows v7.22.0 (5225) System version: | `Microsoft Windows NT 10.0.26100.0` Browser: | Firefox License type: | paid AdGuard driver: | WFP Tracking protection: | **General settings**:
Block trackers,
Strip URLs from tracking parameters,
Hide your search queries,
Send Do-Not-Track header

**Tracking methods**:
Self-destructing third-party cookies (180),
Self-destructing first-party cookies (2200),
Disable cache for third-party requests

**Browser API**:
Block Push API,
Block Location API

**Windows tracking**:
Disable Windows Telemetry,
Turn off Advertising ID

**Miscellaneous**:
Hide your Referrer from third-parties (custom referer),
Hide your User-Agent (custom user-agent),
Hide your IP address (208.54.104.184),
Remove X-Client-Data header from HTTP requests,
Protect against DPI DNS filtering: | disabled Filters: | Ad blocking:
AdGuard Base

Privacy:
AdGuard Tracking Protection,
AdGuard URL Tracking

Social widgets:
AdGuard Social Media

Annoyances:
AdGuard Cookie Notices,
AdGuard Popups,
AdGuard Mobile App Banners,
AdGuard Other Annoyances,
AdGuard Widgets

Other:
Filter unblocking search ads and self-promotion Custom filters: | `User rules (url: none)` Browsing Security: | enabled Browsing Security statistics: | enabled Userscripts: | disabled Userstyles: | disabled Other extensions used: | `No anti-virus. Only adGuard setup on my PC.` ### Issue configuration [Import](https://reports.adguard.com/settings/import.html?product_type=win&product_version=7.22.0+%285225%29&system_version=Microsoft+Windows+NT+10.0.26100.0&browser=firefox&filters=2.3.4.10.17.18.19.20.21.22&custom_filters=User%2520rules%2520%28url%253A%2520none%29&dns_servers=System&userscripts=AdGuard%2520Extra%2520%28url%253A%2520https%253A%252F%252Fuserscripts.adtidy.org%252Frelease%252Fadguard-extra%252F1.0%252Fadguard-extra.user.js%29%252C%250AAdGuard%2520Popup%2520Blocker%2520%28url%253A%2520https%253A%252F%252Fuserscripts.adtidy.org%252Frelease%252Fpopup-blocker%252F2.5%252Fpopupblocker.user.js%29%252C%250AWeb%2520of%2520Trust%2520%28url%253A%2520https%253A%252F%252Fuserscripts.adtidy.org%252Frelease%252Fadguard-wot%252F1.0%252Fwot.user.js%29&dns.filters=1.15%252C%250AUser%2520rules%2520%28url%253A%2520none%29&dns.filters_enabled=true&dns.enabled=false&browsing_security.enabled=true&browsing_security.statistics_enabled=true&stealth.enabled=true&stealth.webrtc=false&stealth.push=true&stealth.location=true&stealth.flash=false&stealth.java=false&stealth.strip_url=true&stealth.hide_search_queries=true&stealth.DNT=true&stealth.referrer=custom%2520referer&stealth.user_agent=custom%2520user-agent&stealth.ip=208.54.104.184&stealth.x_client=true&stealth.dpi=true&stealth.third_party_cookies=180&stealth.first_party_cookies=2200&stealth.disable_third_party_cache=true&stealth.block_third_party_auth=false&stealth.block_trackers=true&stealth.disable_wap_push_message_routing_service=false&stealth.disable_windows_defender=false&stealth.disable_windows_telemetry=true&stealth.turn_off_advertising_id=true&referrer=&win.wfp=true&license_type=paid&scheme_version=2&adblocking.enabled=true)

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Annoyance) [https://www.x.com/i/user/380749300](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.x.com%2Fi%2Fuser%2F380749300) ### Comment > > This issue concerns the promotion of X’s mobile app appearing when opening an account profile in a browser. > > I’ve confirmed reproduction on iOS Safari and Windows Chrome (with the user agent set to `Mozilla/5.0 (iPhone; CPU iPhone OS 18_6_2 like Mac OS X) AppleWebKit/605.1.15 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/18.6 Mobile/15E148 Safari/604.1`). > Considering the possibility of geo dependency, I tested with IP addresses from the Italy, Japan, and Germany confirmed it reproduces. > > In attempting to reproduce this issue using an iPhone, I took care with the following matters: > I cleared Safari’s cache. > I ensured no extensions other than AdGuard were enabled. > I powered off the iPhone and then restarted it. > In Safari settings, I disabled all content blockers and then re-enabled them. > After that, I restarted Safari. > I also restarted AdGuard, and checked for filter updates in AdGuard. During the filter update, I kept the AdGuard window open for two minutes. > ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/kpmisbthrnkw8swk404gwc4g8k0swsk67rdd1oay14.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 2 ![Screenshot 2](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/n40l2rcx1dcooggkgg888004www4cc07u4ep2v0wjk.jpg?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard for iOS v4.5.12 License type: | paid Advanced protection: | enabled DNS filtering: | disabled Filters: | Ad blocking:
AdGuard Base,
AdGuard Mobile Ads

Privacy:
AdGuard Tracking Protection

Social widgets:
AdGuard Social Media

Annoyances:
AdGuard Popups,
AdGuard Mobile App Banners,
AdGuard Other Annoyances,
AdGuard Widgets

comment.body: I think this is fixed [here](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/214437#issuecomment-3361460564), as it seems to be the same issue.

comment.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.bing.com/search?pc=MOZI&form=MOZLBR&q=AdGuard&rdr=1&rdrig=2835075081CF4E17A8045FFF32893DB9](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bing.com%2Fsearch%3Fpc%3DMOZI%26form%3DMOZLBR%26q%3DAdGuard%26rdr%3D1%26rdrig%3D2835075081CF4E17A8045FFF32893DB9) ### Comment > Bing検索をすると検索結果のページが何度かロードのような動作を繰り返したあと、通常と異なる検索結果が表示されます。Copilot検索のページでは何も表示されなくなります。 > これは試した限りFirefoxとAdGuard for Windowsの組み合わせで発生し、Microsoft EdgeとAdGuard for Windows、FirefoxとuBlock Originでは発生しませんでした。 ``` Username: @mori-jio ``` ### Screenshots
